result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Anthony Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

The victim is not in court but requesting that the no contact order be modified to no violent contact. Court will allow no violent contact after the defendant attends 7 sessions in the batterer's treatment program.
Correction reflects 90 condition time imposed and stayed.

Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
Received and filed:
2nd Amended Information.
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....
As to counts 2, 3 and 4 in the amended information:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing,
Parties wish to proceed to sentencing.
The victim was notified by phone.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
As to count 2:
  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 112 days served. No restitution.
As to counts 3 and 4:
  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction as to count 3 and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 4, consecutive to any sentence and consecutive to each other; credit for -0- days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 years with the following conditions:

- Court IMPOSES and STAYS 90 Days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.  
- Follow all rules of probation.
-Batterers Intervention Treatment.
-Parenting classes and any other counseling as deemed appropriate.
- AODA and Mental Health assessment and any treatment if needed only.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons
- Defendant to have no contact with the victim unless approved by the court.  Court will allow 3rd party contact when dealing with the child.
-Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by end of probation, including DV assessment and supervision charges.
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to pay DNA surcharge if not already paid.
Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered case calendared for a probation review hearing in branch 36.

Defendant Charles Anthony Turner NOT in court. Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Amended Criminal Compliant & Amended Information. 
Amended Complaint & Amended Information Read: 
COUNT 1: Strangulation & Suffocation, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.235(1), 973.055(1) a class H Felony.
COUNT 2: Resisting An Officer Causing A Soft Tissue Injury To Officer, contrary to Wis. Stat. 946.41(2r), a class H Felony.
COUNT 3: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 973.055(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 4: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 973.055(1), a class B Misdemeanor.
Initial Appearance & Arraignment NOT held, to be addressed on day of Jury Trial. Final Pretrial held, parties ready to proceed to trail. State's offer is open until 7/20/2015.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Jury Trial on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant Charles Anthony Turner not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set as a Bail/Bond Hearing. Defendant NOT produced. Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court modified the order to allow for telephone contact ONLY while defendant is in custody. If defendant released from custody, reverts to a FULL NO CONTACT ORDER. Case remains set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.

Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Lyndon Evans.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Case set for Bail Hearing, Final Pretrial  in branch 23 & Jury Trial in successor branch.  Bail/Bond Hearing 5/20/2015 at 8:30 AM. Final Pretrial 7/9/2015 at 8:30 AM. Jury Trial 8/3/2015 at 8:30 AM.
Case on Branch 40 calendar in error.  Case is retabbed to Judge Grady on 5/05/15 at 8:30 am

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHOA H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Charles Anthony Turner in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
